feed.title: LF-Air
feed.subtitle: RSS feed based on RSS and LLM.

entry.title: Vite report on Mon, 21 Aug 2023 20:01:21
entry.summary:
Report:

Tech:
- AI-generated art cannot be copyrighted, according to a federal judge's ruling, which could have implications for Hollywood studios.
- OpenAI's Sam Altman received a message from an AI startup founder as a last-ditch effort to save her company, and it was successful.
- Google AI introduces CHITA, an optimization-based approach for pruning pre-trained neural networks at scale.
- Cruise is reducing its robotaxi fleet by 50% following two crashes in San Francisco.
- Tesla is suing two former employees over a significant data breach.
- Guide to generating iOS certificates and profile files for app development.

Business:
- Bill Gates admits to finding school uninteresting and being lazy at math during his youth.
- Legendary investor Jeremy Grantham sees similarities to the dot-com bubble in current markets and predicts a stock slump and recession.
- Global stock markets have been buoyed by people ignoring risks in China and Russia, according to a veteran investor.
- Private lenders have left millions of college students without hope for the future.
- New York workers are waiting for $79 million in back wages.
- Olin Co. VP sells 800 shares of stock, according to insider selling reports.

AI:
- AI-generated art cannot be copyrighted, according to a federal judge's ruling, which could have implications for Hollywood studios.
- OpenAI's Sam Altman received a message from an AI startup founder as a last-ditch effort to save her company, and it was successful.
- Google AI introduces CHITA, an optimization-based approach for pruning pre-trained neural networks at scale.
- Microsoft's Satya Nadella is winning the AI war in Big Tech.

Other:
- Today's mortgage and refinance rates are at 7%, which seems to be the new normal.
- Airbnb and Vrbo operators are considering if the headaches of hosting are worth it after an unpredictable summer.
- Some states are offering incentives to build tiny homes in backyards.
- Tesla owners claim to have been trapped inside their EVs after losing power.
- Zanifu raises $11.2M to scale its inventory financing offering in Kenya.
- The ice cores will allow us to look 1.5 million years into the past.
- First Russian moon mission in 47 years suddenly ceases to exist.
- A Hawaiian county has a radical plan to deal with sea level rise.
- A pet wellness brand is offering dogs $100 an hour to be peanut butter ambassadors.
- Common Facebook Marketplace scams and how to avoid them.
- The story of Steve Jobs "blowing up" over a photographer is an example of his volatile personality.
- Ecuador's runoff election pits a socialist against a banana baron.

Insights:
- The ruling on AI-generated art not being copyrightable raises questions about intellectual property in the digital age.
- The success of the AI startup founder's message to Sam Altman highlights the potential of AI in problem-solving.
- Google's CHITA offers a scalable solution for optimizing pre-trained neural networks.
- Tesla's data breach and subsequent lawsuit emphasize the importance of data security.
- Satya Nadella's success in the AI war showcases Microsoft's advancements in the field.
- The unpredictability of the summer has led to Airbnb and Vrbo operators reevaluating the benefits of hosting.
- The incentives to build tiny homes reflect a growing trend towards sustainable and affordable housing.
- The sudden halt of the Russian moon mission raises questions about the country's space program.
- The ice cores provide valuable insights into Earth's climate history.
- The radical plan in Hawaii demonstrates the urgency of addressing climate change impacts.
- The delays in back wages for New York workers highlight issues with labor rights and fair compensation.
- The story of the liver transplant decision raises ethical considerations in medical procedures.
- Insider selling reports indicate potential shifts in stock market dynamics.
- The move from New York City to Paris at an older age showcases the desire for new experiences and adventures.
- The Walmart delivery driver scam highlights the importance of verifying identities and ensuring customer safety.
- The pet wellness brand's offer to dogs showcases the growing market for pet influencers and brand ambassadors.
- Awareness of common Facebook Marketplace scams can help users avoid fraudulent transactions.
- Steve Jobs' reaction to the photographer exemplifies his intense personality and perfectionism.
- RAVEN offers improvements to language models, addressing their limitations.
- Ecuador's runoff election reflects a political divide between socialism and corporate influence.
